message.content:
cs.LG, cs.NA, cs.DS, cs.AI, cs.CV

The paper proposes an efficient approximation of gradient-based sampling, which is relevant to optimization algorithms for large-scale applications. This suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the Machine Learning (cs.LG) or Numerical Analysis (cs.NA) sub-categories. Additionally, the paper proposes a generic sampling scheme that can be integrated into existing algorithms, which suggests that it may also be relevant to the Data Structures and Algorithms (cs.DS) sub-category. The paper also mentions that the proposed sampling scheme can be used with coordinate-descent (CD) and stochastic gradient descent (SGD), which are commonly used in Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI) and Computer Vision (cs.CV) applications. Therefore, the most likely sub-categories are cs.LG, cs.NA, cs.DS, cs.AI, and cs.CV, in that order.
